body_html: @umarniz Thanks for the guide. However, I think, what most people here anticipate to see is TensorFlow running natively on Windows because of GPU support. That unfortunately doesn't work with Docker as far as I know nor any other solution using virtualization...
body_text: @umarniz Thanks for the guide. However, I think, what most people here anticipate to see is TensorFlow running natively on Windows because of GPU support. That unfortunately doesn't work with Docker as far as I know nor any other solution using virtualization...
body: @umarniz Thanks for the guide. However, I think, what most people here anticipate to see is TensorFlow running natively on Windows **because of GPU support**. That unfortunately doesn't work with Docker as far as I know nor any other solution using virtualization...
